hook.text: Prices rise, so workers demand higher wages. Higher wages raise costs, so prices rise again.

buildup.text: A wage-price spiral is a feedback loop where inflation feeds itself through labor markets.

discovery.text: In the 1970s, strong unions negotiated automatic cost-of-living raises, locking in the spiral.

twist.text: Breaking the spiral usually requires a recession. Someone has to absorb the pain.

climax.text: Central banks watch wage growth closely. Rising wages are welcome â€” until they outpace productivity.

punchline.text: When wages chase prices, nobody wins.
